content: Hey! I'm starting this topic to brainstorm how we might be able to add a button that would make the n keyboard shortcut ("go to next unread topic") accessible via mouse. Having a button would also make the keyboard option more discoverable.
One idea might be to put it in the blank space below the last message in a topic.
What do folks think?
I think that is a good place to put it.

you mean without creating new blank space?
it might look very busy (and repetitive) in interleaved views

Ken Clary said:

you mean without creating new blank space?
it might look very busy (and repetitive) in interleaved views

I think we could just show the button when you're in topic narrows. (It's unclear whether Alya was implying that already.)
Ah, I wasn't super clear, but topic narrows are what I had in mind, yeah.
Filed #18728. I'd be excited to see someone pick this up!

How about something like this in recent topics too
recent topics.png
Just initial thought, suggestion on text, design welcome.
next at bottom.png
next on recipient bar.png
(with tooltip)
Personally, I would like it to be placed in the recipient bar where I don't have to see it at all.
But for new users or non-technical users, a button at the bottom which is clearly visible may be best.
We would be competing for space with typing indicators on small screens.
So, for small screens, just showing icon at the bottom should be enough or smartly do so if a user is typing.
If we are placing them at bottom, I definitely want the option to hide them.
Also, we can hide it when compose box is open. Since user is interested in the current topic and not in the next for now.

When I'm scrolling though a topic with the mouse, my cursor generally ends up centered under the last message. Assuming it's the case for other folks as well, that would be the most convenient location for the "next" button.
If the words on the button are distracting, perhaps we can just use an icon and hide the explanation in a tool tip?

Yeah, I think under the last message makes sense for that reason.

I guess a tricky thing, though, is: a key part of the n workflow is that you keep hitting it repeatedly. So we wouldn't want it jumping around; it should stay in the same place under your cursor as you sweep through a bunch of short threads.

compose closed
compose open

Another idea I had is to show it when compose is closed and just above it. This actually gives us space to show other buttons there if we want to too.
Center alignment just below last message
We can do similar thing with this, just hide the button when compose is open.
next with recent topics
Cool! Hiding the button when the compose box is open seems good -- I don't think going through topics with it open is a common workflow, and it's consistent with how the keyboard shortcut works.
I feel like the center button would be more conveniently located for where one's mouse is while using Zulip, but we can play with it on CZO.
I wonder if the button is a little too bright and might be distracting when reading one's messages?
(Super excited to see progress on this, by the way! :))
I like the centered buttons in the last couple screenshots.
And a nice thing about them is that it aligns with something we already want to do for the "spectators" view, which is having a "Recent topics" link there to help with discovery.
Opened #20244 based on feedback here.
